intro: Shawia steetzii, commonly known as the steetzii spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is known for its diverse and often ornamental species. The plant features small, yellowish-green flowers clustered in cyathia, which are characteristic of the genus Shawia. Its leaves are typically oval and have a slightly succulent texture, adapting to its arid habitat. Shawia steetzii is often cultivated for its unique appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
